misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The key generation function uses a low iteration count (11010) and a short key length (16 bytes) which makes the encryption weak.
recommendation: Use a higher iteration count (at least 100000) and a longer key length (at least 32 bytes) to make the encryption more secure. Additionally, using a proper password-based key derivation function (PBKDF) such as PBKDF2 or bcrypt is recommended.
